Output allocation matrix

output_allocation_matrix.Rd

Returns output allocation matrix after passing an input-output matrix and a final demand vector as input.

output_allocation_matrix(X,d)

Arguments

X

input-output matrix
d

final demand vector

Value

output_allocation_matrix() returns a matrix, when the X matrix is not a square matrix or the d vector has a different number of elements than the number of rows in X it returns an error.

References

Suahasil Nazara & Dong Guo & Geoffrey J.D. Hewings & Chokri Dridi, 2004. "PyIO: Input-Output Analysis with Python," Urban/Regional 0409002, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, USA.

Examples

  set.seed(200100)
  X <- matrix(rnorm(100), nrow = 10)
  d <- rnorm(10)
  output_allocation_matrix(X,d)
